alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Here is a quote from Galileo: 'The book of nature is written in the language of mathematics ... without which it is impossible to understand a single word; without which there is only a vain wandering through a dark labyrinth'. I think Prof Galilei was not quite accurate in his assessment of true mathematics. I would paraphrase it, 'The book of mathematics is written in the language of nature, without which understanding is merely unrooted imagination, vain wandering through a dark labyrinth in the human psyche'. Mathematics does not exist in nature."

- Hilton Ratcliffe, Declaration of Intent: Swimming with the salmon, dining with the bears, December 2008
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Galileo's Claim that the Book of Nature is Written in the Language of Mathematics
